tuAZnC7VInmsO5oDQ_TkXg.text: Overpriced.  Caloric-ally dense.  And uneven service.  Sometimes it's a hit.  Sometimes it's a disaster.  ...but it is always pricey.

kpZYZ2qxJghnDLc91zKFpw.text: On Sunday I brought my family to the Cadillac Ranch for a dinner after a movie. The weather was nice and we had hoped to sit outside. When we asked the Hostess if we could sit outside she said the patio was closed.  We were then seated at a table next to a column. Our waiter was prompt and took our drink orders OK. When the drinks were delivered my wife's drink spilled a little. At that time we had no napkins or flatware. I got up and retrieved them from a nearby empty booth. The food was average and overpriced. We then had two people form the waitstaff checking on us and both were there when we were presented with the bill. It felt like they were confused about whose table we were at. The whole experience was disconcerting. I would not recommend this place for a dinner.

HO3PlParV1erqcNtU2Yw4g.text: I thought Cadillac ranch had a great set up inside with plenty of space and a nice set up outside with someone playing music. I also had a sirloin steak which I thought was great and well seasoned. my only complaint would be pricey drinks

2Rnp3LL_BPnZIvDqIXIgGA.text: The bone-in Rib-Eye is excellent!  They even have a very good wedge salad, but it can't compare to Outback.  But who goes to a steak house for a salad, anyway.  The service is usually pretty good.  It's usually noisy, even during somewhat slow times due to the TVs all over the place and music playing.  It's definitely not a place for a romantic meal.  But the food is really good.

9Uoor6lEtftBeZUlHOofmg.text: Had a mid-week, early evening dinner with a business associate. Restaurant was just over 50% of capacity and we were approached quickly by our waiter who did a terrific job throughout our meal.   Not knowing the size of the item we started the dinner with an order of Cadillac Ranch Kettle Chips which were tasty and sized for a group of four. His sirloin with a side of asparagus was correctly cooked and my Chicken Carbonara was above average.  Cadillac Ranch would be a great place for a small group (we observed 3 groups of 6-8 friends/co-workers enjoying large table settings) and most families. The decor is fun and there are enough TV's for most sports junkies. If you're looking for a quiet setting that's conducive to quiet conversation, this is definitely not the place. Prices are reasonable as we escaped with a tab of around $75 that included the appetizer, entrees, cocktail, soft drinks and gratuity.  Give it a try. It's an interest setting where we found good service, and above average food at a decent price.

mnyFCgpSm1_Ri8JkYGDs-Q.text: Decent. Patio is great. Spacious and a nice hangout spot. The boneless wings were $5 and Cadillac style was like a honey sirrachah. The pecan crusted pork was a huge amount of food. The sweet potato tots lacked a little in terms of flavor and made for an interesting pairing with the pecan crusting...kind of like sweet potatoes pie you'd have for thanksgiving...maybe too rich of a sweet dish for dinner. Fiance had the sirloin steak...cooked how he ordered it...nice peppery flavor, broccoli was cooked well...mashed potatoes were ok. Would go again!

OIFS-AB6Vdg7YjdINH3-rw.text: We visited Cadillac Ranch with a party of 15. We called ahead to make a reservation,  upon arrival the hostess advised us because we were such a large party to sit beside or close to anyone that you were going to be sharing a bill with.  Half of our party was seated,  we were approached by our servers to take drink orders.  While they were away,  more people arrived and we had to adjust seating.  When our servers returned,  we were snapped at and asked if we had chosen our final seats.  Rude.  We were treated with absolutely nothing but attitude by one of the servers the entire time.  Maybe she didn't get the memo that big parties = big tips. The majority of our food arrived on time but one of the meals did not arrive until nearly everyone was finished.  Not even an apology. The food is not worth the cost.  Period.  We work relatively close for a large Pittsburgh company and although convenient,  we will be sure to steer clear of Cadillac Ranch for any future outtings.

1vR5LtUh9k19jc2_ipVKBg.text: I'm in Steel Town on business and was looking for a good burger place. I saw the Cadillac Ranch and thought it looked promising. Inside the decor is nice...very traditional sports bar with lots of TVs and sports images. It's very clean and overall looks good.   However, my meal was disappointing. I ordered the A1 burger. As always, I ordered it medium, challenging the chef's skills at making the perfect burger. He got it wrong, my burger was well done and a bit dry. If you're going to screw up a medium burger I'd prefer it be well done, so at least I can eat it. But I was disappointed. The beer selection is also traditional, I didn't see anything different, or local, to try.   I should have checked Yelp first before going, since the reviews aren't raving. Lesson learned.

8rE4TmcgG82lyFs1OYbnEw.text: Another enigma in Pittsburgh dining. Why does a place called Cadillac Ranch come with a country western theme? Why does it have a bull ride off to one side? Why do they remove the tables for a certain area and have line dancing? Blah  What does Cadillac Ranch have? Bad food, Highly caloric bad food. With my trusty smart phone in hand, I went to their websight, looked up the nutritional guide and not one thing on the dinner menu had anything healthy. Mac & Cheese with blackened chicken: 3500 calories and over 120 grams of fat. Luckily, beer is vegan. myself and friend of Joe named Jamie (also fellow vegan friend of Joe, Jamie) went in here one night after having a wonderful dinner at nearby, Loving Hut (Read my Review!) and stopped by the Barnes and Noble next door. I remembered the Buccos were playing and I said to Jamie, Let's stop at Cadillac Ranch and have a cold one.  Buccos blew the game in the sixth when we sat down, I sat in front of the taps and saw Stone IPA, mouth already watering I ordered one. Extended happy hour? My beer was only three bucks, and that was a full pint. Good deal. Jamie had a wheat beer that i never caught the name of, the guy always goes for the wheat.  As it goes, they had a duo playing guitars on the patio mostly cover Black Crows tunes, the crowd seemed to enjoy them. I watched the big screens behind the bar and enjoyed people watching. The frat boys on my other side ordered wings that looked pretty good. Nice and meaty, pretty good size, more of the meaty wing joint than the "other" part of the wing. Probably 8 or ten in an order. The place was packed.   So I gave you the good with the bad, I'll leave it up to you to decide your own fate.

ygR0-3IWrOJX__G82NBksw.text: The two young ladies immediately greeted me when I entered the restaurant and directed me to my friends that were already seated.    Our server, Sonya, was OUTSTANDING.  After reprimanding me for being late (she was just joking), that started the enjoyable service.  Sonya was friendly, funny and professional, especially after we all kept changing our minds.   After looking at the regular menu, there was a special menu with a roast turkey dinner, since it was a week or so before Thanksgiving. This meal was excellent, with real roasted turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, green beans and cranberry sauce (not the jelly kind, but a really tasty one).  The meal could have been hotter, but it was very good and plenty for lunch the next day.  The price was reasonable,   Having been to the CR several times, I have never had a bad meal, poor service, or a bad experience.

qN4JyTBmGrm9gypiI_aAOw.text: A great place to eat with a fun atmosphere. I love going here when I travel to Pittsburgh. It's always a delight.

XKljpCjE5Wxuz9JfuY4kXA.text: Try the shrimp crab Pasta! The best thing on the menu. Nice amount of shrimp and loaded with crab meat.

48gwdt0X8YL9X2Eb3eIoQA.text: Just wonderful.   Had the blackened tilapia sandwich and it was lovely, the accompanying potatoes with cream sauce were super.

971HNfcmarMQDvyJVr3-pg.text: This is a decent spot if you are into larger venues and chain restaurants. (I'm not sure this is actually a chain, but it definitely has the look and feel of one.) The food is good enough (again - typical chain restaurant food), although it took quite a while for it to come out. All in all, this is not my kind of spot but it is convenient and I love the huge outdoor patio.

IEcJBCGHia6dn-lnqFbaIQ.text: Went to CR for dinner with Mom and my lovely wife. Two of us had the chicken pot pie. It was unlike any cpp  I've ever had. It consisted of a mashed potato foundation, a dusting of veggies, all topped with thick turkey gravy.  The flakey pastry piece consisted of two triangles that looked like apple turnovers without the fruit, on the side of the bowel. The few chicken pieces included a multitude of chicken neck bones and the chicken tail, were disappointing. We both spent time in the bathroom within 1 hour of dinner. They get one star because the waitress was nice.

2gH0r7M-qPM6rT_vONy0SQ.text: Terrible service. Sat at the bar for almost 2 hours...waited 30 minutes to even have a bartender approach us. Once we got his attention he never came back unless our glass was empty. We wanted to order food and it took so long we contemplated even ordering. But we did. Lackluster and not worth the wait. They weren't even busy. Waste of time and money.

dG72JdCcowJqMhH0W4J5Zw.text: This place confuses me. It seems to try to be a classier version of Texas Roadhouse with having food half as good (let's be real, TRH has amazing ribs). I had the Asian Salad, for which I don't remember the exact name, and it was OK. It wasn't bad, but I thought the prices for everything were ridiculous. None of the appetizers were less than about $8 and the cheapest glass of wine was $8 or $9. Not that I think it's out of line or even all that much, but if I'm going to spend that much, then I could easily greatly increase the quality and "cool" factor by choosing a restaurant in the city.

3vQfftC6l51yUwznD3mTKw.text: Came here for a dinner party with work. Service was great, no complaints there. I feel like the food was just blah. Nothing special. Seems like they just tried to dump a bunch of butter and too much salt on everything to make it good. Nothing special, not worth the price. Probably won't be back.

XcZRt0H7HmMYrgxvEAtJUQ.text: How hard is it to mess up a Pittsburgh Steak Salad?  Not hard if you come here.  Service was a little slow considering the place was almost empty. The fries on it were hard (and I mean crunchy hard) and the steak on both my salad and my wife's salad was undercooked.  When we complained about it our waitress did nothing to make it better, just apologized and told us she'd let the kitchen know.  Would have gotten a better review if they had actually fixed the issues, would not have been that difficult.

fkDFBPFR8YFEcNMczbIRCQ.text: Typical chain bar average overpriced food.  I have been to the location twice and don't get me wrong the food is okay but the prices are high and that's not good when the food is just edible.  It is a large place and a bit easier to get a table in this busy location but i'd say just get there a bit earlier and go to Anthony's pizza.

4vpW02NHcZtDyu2AA9DpnQ.text: I've been to this location a few times and to another several times. Most items are at least average, but nothing is really great, except for maybe the Cadillac Ranch Kettle Chips app, which I LOVE! The burgers are pretty good as well, but not my first choice for a burger with so many other great options in the Burgh.  Yesterday, I tried the Asian Chicken Salad, which was pretty lackluster. It has soggy lettuce and flavorless dressing. The only flavor was imparted by the limited Szechwan peanut sauce and the only enjoyable texture came from the crispy wonton strips. I was going to get the Pittsburgh Steak Salad, but it was a bit too pricey in a land where you can get the same thing at nearly any pizza joint and be at least confident that it will be OK for half the price. The lady got a side of sweet potato tots, which sounded like they were going to be awesome, but they were not crunchy enough and very mushy inside.  Overall, I would say there are some safe bets here, but there are items that will leave you disappointed.

OKoS-rb9kNwIPhBi49CaUA.text: Disgusting. The floors are so sticky, my shoe stuck and I stepped out of it. The serving staff smokes on premises in their break area, and the smell of cigarette smoke permeates very strongly into the dining room. We ate food there, against my better judgment. My burger was decent, but the fries were lukewarm. The bathroom is all black, including the toilets, which usually means they don't clean the place very well. Put it this way, I cleaned off the bottom of my shoes when I got home to remove the sticky whatever-it-was. This place is gross. I don't intend to come back here.

fmbOx7ZupfINuZW2vq1NTQ.text: Went for the first time on Mother's Day. Staff was polite and friendly. Food all came out exactly as ordered and in a timely fashion. Overall great experience

QVDMtKA7duCEfwao5_cy-w.text: My husband and I went here to have dinner and drinks at the bar as soon as we sat down we received "dirty" looks from the bartender which we have never seen this women before in our lives we my husband and I both looked at each other like what the heck is going on. She finally came over to us after having a long conversation with the guys a few bar stools away from us when she did come over she didn't greet us she just said what do u want to drink? I said can I have a drink menu please she handed me a food menu with a few beers on it and I knew it was not the drink menu because we have been there many times before. When she handed me the menu she rolled her eyes. My husband and I immediately felt uncomfortable. She set my husbands drink down and said do you have a card for a tab and we decided we wanted to leave so my husband said we will just pay cash and we are ready to leave . She never brought a check we left $20 and she swiped it off the bar didn't say a word and then didn't bring the change for a awhile longer needless to say we won't be going back.

3lbFwTstVpKCkeKLUsT2wg.text: This place stinks. The food is like some microwaved frozen crap. I had the fish-n-chips this time, but I've also had the burger (yes, I came back -- it looks so good from the outside, and I always stay at the hotels across the street when I come to Pitt). The beer selection is okay, and the ambiance is okay, too. The service is terrible (but not as bad as Hertz, of course).

wKXLsqyiOxKna_nxOLCLhQ.text: I should have listened to my inside voice....this isn't a place to get a good meal..maybe a beer and watch a game on TV.  Ordered the meatloaf with onion straws, mashed potatoes and broccoli.  It all sucked.  Couldn't chew through the veggies....weren't cooked.  The onion straws were like bungee cord and the meat loaf I wonder if it contained any meat.  The service sucked to.  I had to ask for my bill as I never saw her after she took my order.  Avoid ordering food...get a beer instead.  They did take half off my bill though when the waitress asked how my meal was.

QsytrvpEWuZL02DMoPy8pw.text: The food is alright. I've been here a couple of times and it's been hit or miss with my meal. The service here is fantastic!

7-9uP8zlRoUeBYdfQJUAkg.text: Service is pretty bad here.  Second time I've come here to sit at the bar and be ignored.   Frank the bartender barely got me what I wanted without flagging him down.   Bar was practically empty at 7 pm while rest of Settlers Ridge packed.  Bartenders more interested in talking to each other.   When asking about food bartender's answers were 'ok' for chicken philly and "if you aren't that hungry it's small" for the brisket sandwich.   Last time I'll go in there.  Really should give one star but the beer was cold.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Empty...

jiufMSX4Z7UBxiqt_3LBdg.text: One time visit last night.  Waitress was Sonny.  Excellent in all respects; managed many tables without a hitch.  And split the bill on our large party which was very helpful.  Food, everyone said they liked theirs.  Mine was the flatbread house pizza.  Flatbreads have near zero tolerance on time/temperature.  Mine was done perfectly.  Watering -- fine; drink refreshment -- fine.  Layout, wide and varied.  Dozens of big screen tv's -- located in a major shopping mall area.  Put in a live band and they would rock (so to speak).  Prices in line with chains in the area.    What caught my attention was the communication about a chardonnay that was ordered; the waitress said, I think it is a cut above "house brands," but if you do not like it, we'll find something else for you.  No fuss, no eye rolling, just a service establishment courtesy.  Sonny was a welcome respite from the "oh so many" folk who know nothing about helping people enjoy an evening out.  And as a sports bar it has "pods" of TV's -- perhaps over 24!  (True).  f8 and be there

UOcqv0rNF_yvNpyRjAnlvg.text: Walked in to a hostess on the phone for so long I eventually just sat down in the bar at a high top. Waited 10 mins and literally no one came to take an order. Left. Why I thought it would be any different than every other time is beyond me. DONE. Worst service ever.

uxbhvipfvTQrmDlR2ANxvg.text: We called to find out if the outside patio was open and we were told yes. When we got there, we were told the patio WAS NOT open, but we could order from the bar and take our food outside, which is what we did. We had the pork chops which were excellent. The rating would be higher but the miscommunication lowered the rating.

_rNDSQArC6nXP44Om-mXKg.text: I've never had a bad experience here but sometimes it's super busy and takes a while to get a seat. I like the country atmosphere and the music they play. Their food is also really good! I usually get a salad and they are very large. Their alcoholic drinks are also very unique and delicious.

AJIwA_0tX7X1qdMfu1CXcg.text: We just got out of work and needed a quick bite to eat before grocery shopping and boy are we glad we came here, we sat at the back bar and we were instantly greeted by Patrick our bartender. Great service super knowledgeable and super friendly! Served us some amazing tacos from the happy hour menu and gave us a wonderful description of dessert, because of this guy we are coming back.  My fiance and I out in the restaurant hospitality industry and this guy made our experience wonderful.  Thanks Patrick for making tonight A plus all the way!

WTynIgXwo5W6nPXsiSituQ.text: I'm writing this review as our party of four currently  sit and wait for our food, for the last 40 minutes. We had to ask for our salads after waiting 40 minutes and only two of the three were brought out and our food is no where in site. Our appetizer was brought out in about 8 minutes with no plates or silverware. Very disappointed, some of the worst service I have ever experienced.

ZplECuNfsMEloUrqWndU_w.text: I have worked as a bartender to support myself through both undergrad and graduate school, so, I am a forgiving and patient customer.... That being said, I give poor reviews rarely&only when I feel this will help save someone from a bad&unnecessary experience.   I came here for a drink after seeing a movie and was happy to see such an array of beers on tap! (Plus! Yay. Aka the reason for any stars) soon, I'd find out that my bartender would rather care for the group of attractive women that came in, (sparingly/he had time to come back to me before the next one walked in), instead of filling my empty mug. After the delay, I passed on getting another beer for time constraints and it took another 10 mins or so to get my check! Just asinine. Extremely disappointed and won't be returning.

rBWT0342NuAkshGUhnU89Q.text: The food was just terrible. Ranch macaroni was inedible and I had the fish tacos. They were so small I thought it was appetizer. Beer was fine but $35 for our dinner with 2 drinks and small portions was worthless

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Do not eat

PTo3dhAbi3RE41evMxi0Qw.text: Pathetic. 3 out of 4 in our party got sick. Don't waste your money on this place. Sir poops A-lot

mMZ-0hZyF9AUl2eoplOoZQ.text: First time visitors here and we won't be returning to this location ever again.  We opted to sit in the bar area because there was a 40 minute wait, yet there were numerous open tables.  1. Our waitress either had too many tables that she couldn't handle or she should look for a new job. She was there to take our order and came back quickly when it was time pay but other than that she was rarely seen throughout the meal. We had to ask her and other wait staff to clear dishes from our table on numerous occasions.  2. The food was not impressive. The lobster bisque was barely warm and extremely runny. It was more like a broth instead of a soup. I ordered it with extra crackers and by the time they were finally delivered, the soup was cold. The thousand island dressing tastes funny, sorta like it has ranch in it. The shrimp tacos were also barely warm but the steaks and kids grilled chicken were sizzling hot.  3. We ordered the kids brownie sundae for the 2 kids at our table to split. It took an extremely long time for it to come out and when it was finally placed on the table, the aluminum dish that the brownie came in was so hot that it burned my fingers to touch it. Why would you ever serve a child ANYTHING that was scorching hot?  $180 for 4 adults and 2 children under 4 for just mediocre food is absolutely ridiculous if you ask me.

wQRonuAuivwv4RucJGqbIA.text: An excellent experience here last night! I love the atmosphere and the staff is friendly. We were seated right away (it was around 9) and got drinks promptly. We ordered loaded fries for an app, they were ok. Could've been cheesier but they were crispy and tasty. I always take forever to figure out what I want to eat and the waitress was very patient with me which I appreciate lol. I got blackened tilapia with smashed redskin potatoes and balsamic drizzle - SO GOOD. My boo got fish tacos which were tiny but meant to be a smaller plate- he said they were delicious as well. The server was so accommodating (I always have a billion leftovers) she gave us boxes and to go cups for our drinks (this is a huge thing for me I dunno why) and got the check for us right when we were ready to go. Awesome meal and I'll be back for sure !

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blackened tilapia and redskin potatoes

oM5LlNLwZvLePRlXSjea4w.text: Nothing great about this place.  Typical suburban bar and restaurant.  I was actually attacked inside of this establishment about two years ago.

eCyPlUw6hBB1ChexWFscxA.text: Were seated on the patio and then told there were no servers for the patio... after a server for the remaining table passed us 6 times to wait on a remaining table at 9pm on a beautiful Friday evening after a movie.     Please also clear the tables and WIPE THEM OFF, filthy.  Looked inside, not even crowded.  Staff stands around and bullshits with one another, Your food isn't good enough for people to be expected to put up with this.  Won't be back for a 3rd try.

xk5MmpFnCe3vNeBwohWdsw.text: Update!!.... manager reached out to me about my experience. I admire the business for wanting to be better and inviting me in again. I will def. Be back to do another review on service but thank you for reaching out.  Just left.... 1st night out after 6 months because I had a baby. Me and my husband just wanted to have a drink at a bar ... Cadillac ranch seemed to be the best choice. The 1st bar was full so we sat on the side bar... NOT GREETED FOR 8 MINUTES.  .. heard the couple next to us ask the bartender to take their order... "I'm not a bar tender". ... sat and still waited. NOTHING.  ... come on -try!!!  .... such a waste on 20 min.. we are now taking our dinner and drinks down the road. ... . Don't go..

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MVg2r05LefhXLmJ-gOo6MA.text: Great service, good food and cheap drink specials . We have been here twice and have had good experiences both times.

reCDx-t0fthDRgqUO7w0xA.text: We got in, sat in our table, waited 10-12 mins, no one showed up to say hi or take our order- we left :-/

iJcOpQjyvcIzT25al2Z1-w.text: This is the 2nd time I have eaten at this restaurant.... The first being many moons ago when they opened. I hated it then. I HATED it today. The ONLY reason for the 2nd star is because our waitress was really sweet.   We ordered an appetizer, which was really good (tower of onion rings). I ordered the meatloaf, substituting broccoli for corn. Hubs ordered cowboy cut rib eye, rare. Food comes out. Take a bite and want to spit it out. My meatloaf was DISGUSTING. It was dry. It was over seasoned with some green stuff. There was no BBQ gravy at all. My corn was dry and tasteless. I took maybe 6 bites. It was awful. Husband's steak was cooked Pittsburgh rare..... NOT what he ordered.... He wanted rare. Not charred on the outside, raw on the inside. Served the steak with a dull steak knife. I'm pretty sure the butter knife on the table would have worked better.   We didn't see a single manager even on the floor.... On a Saturday night.... During dinner. Every corporate restaurant I have ever worked at and dined in, it is required for a manager to go to every single table. Apparently not here though. They really should have came to check on us though because I wasn't about to complain to my server. Being in the industry, I know that it isn't the servers fault the kitchen messed up or made things wrong. I wasn't about to put that on her shoulders. She already had 4 drunk morons sitting across from us and several other tables.   We will not be back. I promise that. Paid $75 for a meal we really disliked....

Zk6SoxZTf5zUxOaIGbUWtQ.text: A very large group came here for a working reception. We got the back room and the food was set up along the wall. The service was pretty good. The sliders were ok; the cheese freshly cut; chips and dip a crowd pleaser. I didn't try the wings. Food was replenished relatively quickly.  The place is open and airy and I liked the art on the walls. There are a lot of TVs.  I would recommend the place for this type of outing.

fVRct6pifg_woFjnWQ3Ulw.text: Kids macaroni is out of a box and burnt.  Don't waste your money. When I brought it up to the waitress she argued with me that this is actually what parents prefer and I should have known that is what I would be getting. My child was disgusted by the whole thing. He has better taste and manners than this.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The kids macaroni is out of a box!

kESeZ5dFWArZer1jUDmfCw.text: Been coming to Cadillac Ranch for a few years now so I guess it's about time I wrote review. Had dinner tonight and it was ok. I had the Cajun pasta. My wife and father in law both had BBQ chicken salad. Everyone thought the meals tasted fine.  The restaurant itself wasn't too busy so the service was quick and efficient. It's definitely calmed down since it first opened. That's not a bad thing, just makes it not as exciting. Anyways, three stars it is.

do5dmdvTzeeNGy5B_mbrNw.text: I absolutely love the atmosphere, food and service here! The Spinach dip is one of the best ever tasted!!! You cant go wrong dining here. Whenever Im in Pittsburgh, this is my go to spot!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

SwltqCwZD_T0YNfUiOgjXw.text: Ordered a Shrimp pot boy sandwich for lunch. Wish I would have taken a photo. I asked the server if that was all the shrimp that came on the sandwich...the answer was unfortunately yes. There were barely enough shrimp to cover half the hoagie bun. The server never offered to send over a manager. I had sweet potato fries which were an up charge. Sandwich was $15 for a bun. Never going there again.

GfuYfFFOXifazA5RPFeyZA.text: This place sucked.  I got the lemon chicken, which tasted like grilled chicken soaked in oil, because that's exactly what it looked like:  Chicken bathing in a layer of grease.  No lemon flavor, what so ever.  I was still able to eat is because 1)  I avoid wasting animal products for the sake of the animal 2) I can dab the oil off.  My friend got this steak that was bunt to a crisp.  He didn't even eat it.  The server didn't even ask how everything was or what was wrong with it.  When your customer orders something and doesn't put a dent in it and doesn't want to wrap it up, something's probably wrong and it would be in the server's best interest to ask.  Nope.  Either he didn't give a hoot and/or he's dumb.  "Eek!  Me thinks not" may be a little too harsh.... but I can say in full confidence that I  will not be returning.

fj-CsMDis9Ue-wWBY2em0Q.text: Not great, but okay food. The food is normally decent, but not great and the service is very hit or miss. You can get great service or you can get the kind of service where you have to beg for silverware and napkins... multiple times... and still  have to ask some random other person who works there to finally get what you need. I definitely do not recommend the Thai salad, but most of the other food I've gotten has been pretty good.

nDrO6v_IQaCJTsavM9RbnA.text: You won me back, slowly. I went this past Saturday night and sat at the bar. Ordered the spinach dip and it was delicious! Crowd atmosphere was good and bartender was on the ball.   Only issue was noticing one of the male employees filling the fruit holders for drinks with his hands. The problem with this was that he had just returned with ice and had done some minor cleaning before filling the fruit containers. You should always wash your hands right before handling food.   All in all everything else seemed good.

HfGMPK0IdTbVoRolLH8SLQ.text: I made reservations at the Cadillac Ranch for my daughter's hs graduation. The main reason we chose this spot was because of the outdoor fire pit. There were no issues while making the reservations. The manager Tim was very accommodating, funny and friendly. That is, until half hour into my arrival when he called asking if I wanted to have it indoors due to the possibility of rain. It didn't really look like it would pour; however he subtly pushed for me to agree. So, in the midst of the crowd and taking pictures, I told him we would give it a shot (go indoors); with the idea of going back to my original reservation outside if it didn't look like rain. When we got there, they had set us up inside. It was nice and all but it was extremely loud and we wanted to be able to enjoy the breeze and have conversations. I mean, my family traveled hours to see my daughter graduate; why would we want to sit inside with loud music. Tim said he could turn down the music and we said no; because it's a bar/grill and people were hanging out. Then he admitted that one of the fire pits were broken and the other was taken. He said it had been broken for 2 days. So, here was the truth (it was so obvious what had happened)- They gave our spot, the only working fire pit, to another group; thinking they would leave before we got there. The group never left; therefore, my group got screwed over. But why lie about it? Anyway, we still chose to sit in the fire pit area; despite it being broken. From there, the waitress and Tim did their best to serve us and kept checking in to see if we were good. At the end,  Tim offered us free dessert for the inconvenience. It worked out well because I didn't have enough time to grab my daughter's graduation cake, balloons and champagne from my house, as it was completely out the way. The food was delicious! I ordered the Appetizer Buffet Option #2: bbq wings, sliders, shrimp cocktail, cheese and crackers, and tortillas with artichoke and spinach dip and a veggie tray with ranch. Half the people in our group barely ate and we were able to take the leftovers with us. Overall, despite the incident with the fire pit, I truly enjoyed the ambiance and will recommend this place to friends and family. I will definitely be back! Three stars for an honest review and fire pit disappointment.

lpH91mqd4Oo3cGBNmU23fg.text: It pays to have low expectations!  Stopped here for lunch out of pure curiosity, not expecting much.  Chose to sit on the patio, was greeted in a decent amount of time by Brandy. She was very patient and helpful. Definitely made the experience gain an extra star.  Ordered the spinach dip as an app, like most restaurants there weren't nearly enough chips on the plate but we were delightfully offered more. The dip tasted pretty fresh unlike most chains variations.  My date had the lemon mushroom chicken, which was very tasty. I ordered the Diablo chicken pasta which wasn't as good. The sauce wasn't bad and the pasta cooked to a good temperature but the chicken was just tough and chewy- not of the same consistency as the lemon mushroom chicken.   All in all I'd say this place isn't too far from an Applebee's or Friday's type concept. The restaurant itself was clean and very spacious, sadly I'm not sure if it's completely worth the price.

gwW8DgYLo_zWEt76LnnkkA.text: TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT:  We called ahead and was told there was a 15 minute wait.  We showed up moments later. An hour later we still had not been seated. When we spoke up, we were told it would be another 40 minutes. Once seated, we waited another 20 minutes. Our waiter had very little time for us. He flew through the motions without sincerity. We experienced further disappointment when the food arrived. The burgers were dry. The flatbread crust was cracker-like. The toppings on the flatbread were lacking and flavorless. The shrimp tacos were slider size, speckled with a few shrimp here and there. They were more like an appetizer or kids meals than a regular meal. We left with both our belly's and wallets empty.

7Z3bAUhiUg9V6ZQZ2F7vEg.text: Stopped in for drink before movie. 2pm.  Only one guest at bar.  Was waiting for bartender.  2 other guests came in and the bartender decided to greet and serve them instead. I left.   7/29/16 Manager invited me back & gave me a gift card.  We ate on the outdoor patio with its own bar. It's a really nice patio. The Passion Fruit mojito is very delicious but light on the rum. Can't wait to try more of their cocktails. The service and food were good. The music on the inside is too loud but nice on the patio minus the live performer outside making it loud.

fPReY9Zy-S_tVPvfbHrdsQ.text: Excellent service, food, and drinks. This place should be first on the list to all who visit this area. I recommend the filet mignon and ahi tuna. The folks here make you feel right at home and the ambience is welcoming. Give it a try and have a good time!

gcZveJFM0U8sHEW7YOTb8Q.text: First and last visit. The menu was hard to read. Ordered fish n chips. It was mostly breading. Reordered pork chops with mashed potatoes n green beans. They comped my first selection n took off $10 on the second which I had to take with me because we were late for a concert. On the up side, The decor was nice n the place was clean. Also the pork chops smell good.

wPCSRSUbU-yk9NJAirGbew.text: I was torn about trying the place due to some of the reviews, but they did not disappoint. Good service and the sirloin was cooked perfect. One of the better steaks I have had dining out.

FMg6K5JBgMBsWy8Tq84aKw.text: Cadillac Ranch feels like someone decided to cross a TGI Friday's with a typical nightclub, then throw a thin Southwestern-style decor over everything. The ambiance comes off feeling really shallow, and the wait staff seems about on par for what you'd expect in a venue of this nature - attentive if the place isn't busy, but if you're here on a Friday after work... expect to wait.   They used to have a mechanical bull which was fun to watch drunk people try to ride, but it's gone (heard it needed some work in addition to liability issues).  The clientele here is definitely a bit older. As a 20-something young professional, I found myself getting chatted up by what I'd call "cougars" at least once per visit during happy hour.   The bar isn't anything special selection-wise, either. Not to mention that they charged me $2 to put a drink on the rocks. The next time, I just asked for a glass of ice along with my drink neat, and it didn't cost me a dime. The bartender agreed this was weird, but that's how it works.  There's a number of options in the Settler's Ridge complex which I'd suggest before CR.

pBPkhibuMY3SaDCk7TQdDg.text: Everything about this place is awful. The food is gross & every single thing on the menu is horribly unhealthy. The service is terrible. Everything is overpriced.   I've been here maybe 5 times & it's always because someone plans a happy hour & this is the place that they choose. I want to see my friends but I loathe having come here. And, I noted that other reviewers said they got sick - the first time I ever ate something here I got food poisoning!! I was at the movies after eating something here & had to leave & run home. Was sick all night, thought thankfully was better in the morning.  So last night I was here again to meet up with a bunch of friends & discuss a bachelorette party we were all planning. They have drink specials & discounted apps during happy hour BUT you have to be sitting outside to get them. Um, it was 55 degrees outside. The waitress then said we could sit at the bar, this was after we had been sitting at a table for 20 minutes & had ordered drinks & stuff. Why can't we have the specials too?? Who is the genius who thought it was ok to give some patrons special prices on things & forcing others to pay full price?   Our waitress was half asleep & would disappear for long stretches. She seemed bored and/or annoyed with us. We waited forever for our first round of drinks.  My mushroom flatbread pizza was disgusting. COLD & awful. The cheese wasn't melted, the arugala wasn't the least bit stuck to the rest of the flatbread & the onions weren't caramelized. I paid like $12 for food I didn't even eat. My friends' food looked god awful too & they did some mini desserts - both the sorbet & the cherry cobbler were excessively sweet & nasty.  My bill was $20 for ONE beer & one awful, cold, nasty "flatbread".   After last night, I told my friends, no matter what, I am NOT coming back to this dump. EVER.

jPDK9kLvPNMb4svCLu-zHg.text: Good food, cold draft beer and friendly service.  I enjoyed a fresh, wedge salad and the chicken Diablo pasta.  Both were good.

yYY1wIb3ZVcjboZhYHIGbg.text: Food was absolutely horrible! Just horrible!  I cant believe they serve food like that! They should be ashamed of themselves!

nOkoQUuoEAYg3QVqo9Fy3g.text: So after two recent visits to Cadillac Ranch, I have come to the conclusion that I am unimpressed.    First visit was just to the bar for a few drinks before a show.  The bar staff was inattentive and the simple drinks we ordered left much to be desired as neither had much alcohol present for the hefty price.  We got an appetizer after the bar maid described it to us only for it to come and not be anything like what was described.  Second visit was for dinner.  Two pasta dishes were ordered as well as Filet Mignon.  The pasta dishes were dry, bland and lacked ingredients that were mentioned to be present in the dish on the menu.  The Filet came drenched in A1 sauce.    Once dinner was over, our waitress was no where to be found.    This restaurant has a great atmosphere but must become more than a mediocre drinking hole.

3TrFt2lFJVy0XCo1zV9FVQ.text: I've been to many places in my life and none of them compare to Cadillac Ranch. Beyond the food and tasty ranch dressing, they have a friendly staff who is always willing to go above and beyond. If you come here, you will probably see me because I come here always. 5 stars but only because that is the maximum amount this app will allow. My True rating is Galaxy.

eEFW_XNMO_oWIyIFnkwBGA.text: I went here to meet up with some friends on a Friday evening for few drinks and bites. Nice atmosphere inside and out - the interior was nicely designed with western/country theme and of course.. a mechanical bull if you're sober enough or drunk enough to ride one.  We sat outside on the patio - the service was pretty good. Food .. nothing out of the ordinary.  If I am in that area.. I wouldn't mind going back

CWtOQcXApLr5k_fqiWtgsw.text: UPDATE:  Woke up with gastrointestinal discomfort and a sick feeling the morning after my meal at this place.  I have adjusted my rating accordingly.  Horribly mismanaged restaurant.  Bottom line.  The food was actually pretty decent, when it finally arrived.  That's the only reason that this review gets two stars.  (UPDATED to 1 star after waking up sick from the meal.)  The wait staff was a mixture of new people, like our server Zack, who was eager to please and facing impossible odds, and bad attitude people, like the young woman who ignored us and when stopped by our party, told us that we would be served by another person whom she would tell to come visit our table. (She never bothered to tell him, and we stopped him ourselves after waiting over 20 minutes.)  And then there was the manager, Anna, who didn't look or act like a manager, and who actually argued with us about our food and who made admonishing remarks to us when questioned about the food.    The place wasn't really all that busy, but the bar took forever to get our drinks ready.  Refills were even slower, or we most certainly would have had more drinks and created a larger tab.  We waited a very long time for our food to come out of the kitchen, and several times while we were waiting, other crew members whom we had not previously met came outside and asked us (and every other table around us) if the food they were carrying was for us.  This happened over and over again.  Apparently, even though there were only seven tables in the outdoor dining area, there is no system in place to tell the servers which table to take the food to.    We felt sorry for our waiter.  He was a very conscientious young man who was put in a bad situation.  Three of the four meals were good.  One was simply bad and didn't meet the description on the menu.  The manager (Anna) made some terribly lame excuse about the meal that was not even remotely close to the description on the menu, and actually insulted the person who was unhappy with the food.  The waiter took that poorly prepared meal back and replaced it with another selection that did more closely resemble the description in the menu, and everybody was content until the visit from the manager, who was defensive, argumentive, and seemingly unknowledgable.  Nobody in our party really cared that she had "fifteen years of experience in the business," because the bottom line was that despite the decent quality of the food served, her restaurant was so poorly mismanaged that four people were totally turned off by the experience and  were unanimous in their decision that they'd never give the place a second chance.

SBqO4TTE2LMsLY3s-bdEgw.text: It's an ok place but it used to be much better.  The service is hit or miss, and the food had gone down hill big time!  We used to come here a lot but after a few bad experiences with the food, we avoided Cadillac Ranch for about a year.  Last night we decided to give it another try and it was bad again.  I had the fish and chips, something that used to be good here, but it was so disappointing.  The fish was burnt and the fries were cold.  I gave them another chance, but after last night I won't be back.

vPdpS9g4wv6ftZCkw5ugcw.text: I went here for lunch today. The atmosphere is great, but that's it. There were 2 host's that barely greeted us. We decided to sit at the bar. The restaurant was dead, it was Monday, and the bartender took a while to greet us. He had no personality and did not provide a good service. The food was edible but not good. The nachos should be left to a Mexican restaurant and the cowboy bites were not good. No manager visible anywhere. Not a good sign.

crSNa7UEKXMM71K6YRZBTA.text: Don't listen to the other reviews.  I have been here many times and every time it is awesome.  Will be back for sure.

a_5GD5c9fDC9SY5nEJBQuA.text: Food was pretty good. Service and staff were horrible. Upon walking in there were what appeared to be three hostesses standing up front all huddled together on cell phones. They looked at our group and continued their conversation. I had to say that there will be three of us to get any attention at all. Our waitress was fairly polite. The bartender near by were very rude however, did not smile and it was clear she did not want to be bothered. Our food took quite a while to get to us and it was not even slightly busy. Our dessert took even longer. All in all it was sub par and I would say not worth the prices you will pay.

7uTwxMvfL050uwVV7TaQDA.text: We went here for lunch after a Steeler game and it was a good atmosphere with typical sports bar food which is what we were looking for and had the different games on their many televisions around the restaurant. We had a great time. The service was a tad slow and they didn't seem that busy as the place was packed but had a good crowd and the food was good.

Q_kiRkOdWev7GH4PRimjhg.text: Wow this place has horrible food and below average service. The appetizer came out the same time as the main course. We order the pretzels which were well below average. My wife ordered an mixed drink which was so bad she had to send it back. She ordered a flat bread pizza which resembled cardboard and ketchup. My burger bun was so soggy I am guessing they dipped it in one of the 3 rivers before they brought it out. The only up side was that the beer was cold. kR306sMWlvQO1eiMrrD_Cw.text: Love their bbq chicken salad, other than that, food isn't bad. Good local place to go to, a bit expensive.

eIPEJSoJJdgUlJ05mvQD0Q.text: We've been here 6-10 times and it's always been a good experience.  The food is good, the portion sizes are appropriate and the service is good.

mGDecWxT40wsKKEHBz4P-Q.text: Slow service that doesn't come back often but good food and nice lunch specials!

VkYtvtImXTJp7jmZvd0nHw.text: So so at best, service is good, prices are high considering what you get. The patio is nice when weather allows. Menu is on the lower side of average. It's good for drinks but if you're looking for a meal I'd explore other options. I gave it 3 stars based on the atmosphere and service, the only saving grace.

xXYMOQV_3Ql9QqI3kwT8jw.text: First time visiting this restaurant while visiting Pittsburgh. There's a pretty cool sports bar with tons of TVs and quite a bit of people at the bar! I also ordered a a flatbread which was okay but a lot larger than I expected. Once again not bad for $6 during happy hour. not a great selection of wines however their house wines are only $3 during happy hour silent with that. Excellent service by multiple people making sure I was at end of two at the bar!

gRC9bJurCJDUMmDq-CoGSg.text: Food and drinks have been great! However the service is so absolutely horrible that I don't even want to return! I honestly thought the bartender couldn't smile or show any facial expression but I was wrong because she had no problem smiling and laughing with her coworkers at the other corner! A different time I got a drink and an app on a very slow night maybe 5 tables in the whole place? But it really irritates me when I bust my booty off with a smile everyday and run around like a chicken with my head cut off at my job. xdyxqvgxDu2tZk7Kv_6f-Q.text: So we go in on a Sunday afternoon.  Order a bloody Mary. Bartender says spicy or regular.  I say spicy.  My tab was 11.25 she gave me a double..didn't ask for a double . This is one of the reasons I avoid this place. I am always overcharged.  Si CEO the place opened.

We decided to sit inside anyway, after sitting for 5-10 mins without even being looked at by a server we decided to leave and walked to Walnut Grill. The outdoor seating was open there and the service was great I would give them 5 stars.  I have had good experiences at Cadillac Ranch before but after this one I'm not sure I'll go back.

PPCNDjOlZyDqMisr1DwgTQ.text: The review solely is from happy hour visit after work... one of the better chain happy hours I've ever been to. 5-7pm; $1 off select drafts, $2 off wines and certain cocktails. The food happy hour menu includes $3, $4, and $5 level options and they all seemed awesome (wings, nachos, flatbread pizza). Everything seemed incredibly worth the money and the dead were awesome for happy hour. It did however take a bit of time (maybe because it was packed the day I went after work) but otherwise it was an awesome HH experience and I definitely would return to Cadillac Ranch... especially for those delicious nachos and pretzels sticks! I can't speak to the rest of the menu at all but the place seemed crowded and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves so I'm sure the sit down dinner was also a great deal.

hnqUCC8zuGyeFdLf9By7gQ.text: This could be a much better experience if the wait staff was not so stuck up and catered to all of it's paying customers with equal zeal.  I willl admit that it's live entertainment can generate a very emotional bond to this location but there has to be more to attract me back to this establishment than a few tunes and a cold shoulder.  Somehow I don't see this property or the staff there all that invested in the satisfaction of new clientele but more into regulars who drop a ton of money there which likely is subsidized by daily corporate budgets or entertainment funds.  A clearly showcase type of environment instead of an inviting social endeavor.

so-hlq813GmmOFdGv0BfKw.text: This is a steakhouse that is all about the atmosphere. They do really awesome happy hour specials and it's a fun place to be! A huge central bar and even a second bar off to the side. I think the entrees and regular food are a little overpriced for what you get, but it's not a bad place to check out if you're in the area! Service was wonderful.

Op7jFVgRE8SzMKg7A_Bg0A.text: Ate here twice and was actually impressed for it being a chain restaurant. I thought the food was reasonably priced and the service was friendly. No mix up's or errors and the atmosphere was clean and enjoyable! My only small complaint is that there are little to no healthy options on the menu.

yo9xsLwGLdU2xqRrS71QoQ.text: Food was tastefully average but service not worth the money. Server was inattentive and this wasn't the first time I've had this experience. I haven't been here in over a year so decided to give it a go and same average at best experience. Good place for drinks during warm months on the outside patio but other than that, I'd opt elsewhere.

PIEZv45zqeSeghzvkkbuoQ.text: Everytime I go there I get excellent service and the food is always great. And their happy hour specials are good too, always nice to grab a bite before the movies.

K0iTqPwYHf6dK5W_dVDoSA.text: This was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. This was the first time in my 28 years of life I left $0.00 tip. We walked in on a Thursday evening prob around 6 o'clock. Sat at the bar. The place was not busy AT ALL. When we sat down we noticed the bartenders/waitressing in a group talking and they alllllllllllll looked at us and just went on with their conversations. We continued to sit and wait to be greeted. Another couple walks in- must of been frequent customers- they got greeted right away and got served drinks by the same guy who looked at me and my boyfriend several times with no acknowledgement. Finally a woman comes over. We order right away - drinks and appetizers. That was the last we saw of our "waitress". The food was okay, nothing bad to say about it. But we finished the appetizers and our drinks and continued to just sit. Multiple employees clearly saw our empty plates and glasses. But nothing. And our waitress had disappeared. Finally flagged a different lady down and asked for check. Was told "sure, one second ! ". Again, continued to sit with no check. Waited about another 15 then had to flag same girl down and ask for a second time for our check. The service at this place is beyond awful. The worst i have ever experienced. Please consider hiring new bartenders/waitresses. Very rude and unprofessional.

B_nvSLTGAHWDwfkUW3_xeA.text: My wife and were craving Cadillac Chicken Mac n Cheese. We went to the Robinson location. The seating was OK except for the lights kept blinking above us. We had to move our seats. we ordered and the Chicken Mac N Cheese came in a minimal amount of time (they really were not that busy) As to the food. It could have had some cheese on it. It was supposed to MAC N CHEESE. It was very oily like they used olive oil (and a lot of it) instead of cheese. I really liked there Mac N Cheese and now its like they just don't care anymore!

YI-f5BBcxeXuh74lB7Vscg.text: Nothing to rave about. For the name and appearance I was expecting much more. The burger was dry and lacked seasoning. Plus it tasted like a frozen burger. The nachos were good but not amazing. The service was OK felt rushed to place an order but after the food came out server forget we existed until she wanted the bill to be paid when I asked for a refill of water. After we paid a storm came through the area and knocked out power. The entire staff even after the generator was fired up or the power came back on stood watching it rain. Another customer asked if he could get some service for his table. It was kind of comical as he said you would think they never saw it rain before. Probably wouldn't come back as there are plenty of other choices to spend my money. The prices were on the high side of average.

Vcur3fZXcqwZF2OX-xtBcg.text: Came back for the pork chops and was a bit disappointed that I got the end chop no bone! Manager came and graciously ordered me a bone in chop no problem! Now that's great customer service. Husbands soup was delicious but sliders a bit overcooked. Enjoyed the visit.

M1chHlCvIdmfbMw3laMqdQ.text: If I could give negatives this would be it! Was here two weeks ago, outside bar closed in the summer. Ok, let's go inside.  Three words "slow as balls". Sat at the bar. My friends and I are thirsty! These were like slow mo zombies with no get up and go. Not sure if they even knew they were working there. Soooo, go again, outside bar open. Ok, stay outside! Like um....she clearly was bitten by the sucky-bartender zombies... just left. Never again! Stay away! Place is horrible!!

U74TLtP0JWGULVOVizmwkw.text: This place is honestly pretty meh. Your typical chain-like restaurant (every time I have been it it wasn't by my choice). Kind of pricey for food that tastes like it was microwaved as well.  I honestly don't even remember what I have eaten on either occasion that I was there, just remember thinking that I could have probably had better at some of those other chains that I shall not mention.   The service sucked, and the staff always seem to be in a mood.  The best thing about this place is honestly the drinks. Long Islands for the win!

ULnroDGFY6ONfGahW75r6g.text: Health Department please inspect.  11:30 am 7/24/18. just opened for lunch and the floor is filthy. My shoes stick to the floor while walking. The men's room smells like urine and hasn't been mopped in days.  Food is just okay. I wouldn't eat here again until cleanliness improved.

vIjvZF4F90yZKR-hnpAp7g.text: I probably will not go back. First time going today and I got the Ranch Mac N cheese. The chicken tasted horrible and was tough. I couldn't tell if it was over cooked or raw because it also seemed a little pink. I couldn't tell the waitress cause she rarely came over. When she did, she seemed really annoyed, even though we never asked for anything except for a box for my mom's salad. I don't know if it was because she had a friend there she was trying to talk to, but had to stop and wait on us or if she was having an off day. It didn't help the experience though.

W4PwXFg1FZSURPTQx3TGjQ.text: Start to finish just blah!!!  I arrived at 4:30 to meet friends for happy hour. I sat at the bar. It was made clear to us multiple times that happy hour didn't start until 5!  I had originally spoke with a very kind gentleman bartender who started my tab.  I wanted to wait until everyone arrived to order my food. And also see what the happy hour specials were. I did order a glass of wine  though. There were a few other bartenders working.  I didn't realize they were apparently working together. There was a female that was extremely unhappy . It was clear to all of us.  She never smiled. She must have been having a bad day.  I felt bad for her and uncomfortable at the same time.  I didn't complain or ask for anything special. The food was cold when it arrived. We ordered 5 different appetizers from the happy hour menu. The other 2 bartenders were great but for some reason they were letting the other lady take care of us.  I don't got out often and feel like she put a damper on the whole experience. I hope she has a better day tomorrow. Bar food. Nothing special.

Jpjouax_EGED8ZRtC2W8Cw.text: Stopped in for a lunch today, March 9th around 2:30. Bartender is horrrrible and very slow. Gave us menus. Fine minutes later asked us what we wanted for drinks. Keep in mind there's six people total at the bar. I ordered Cajun pasta and a side Caesar. Salad comes out. No silverware. I wait five minutes and finally have to ask the hostess for silverware as the bartender is nowhere to be found. Now on to the food. Salad was good. There was nothing Cajun about the pasta. Very bland. Salt and pepper helped a little. Asked for a box and the check. 10 minutes later finally get it. Bartender was the worst. Not sitting at the bar ever again.

KLz9L3R25XEjlp39KiqGEQ.text: Update: I was contacted by CR customer service pretty quickly, which is impressive.  They never stated whether the blender is actually broken or not which means it must not have been. Disappointing.   I go to Cadillac Ranch about 3 times a month. I also bring employees every few months. I get the pork chops every time, they are pretty good. The service is normally subpar at best.   Today, at 2:20pm I walked in with my wife and as usual, the girl with ZERO enthusiasm says "2?"  I said yes, two as another girl grabbed two menus and walked to our table. My wife says "thank you" and the girl responds with "yeah" as she is making no eye contact and walking off.   About 10 minutes goes by and no waitress yet. She finally comes and wife orders a frozen margarita. The waitress says your blender is broken, and she isn't sure if it's working because they haven't bought a new one yet.   Three points here 1. Bad service has finally lost a customer. I will never return. 2. You sell $20 pork chops, buy a new blender. 3. I seriously doubt the blender is even broken. I guarantee your employees just didn't want to make one.  YOU THINK THE BLENDER IS BROKEN? THINK?  THEN GO CHECK!!!! WOW...  if the company wants to find out who the employees were, just ask them about the guy who told them they sucked as he walked out.   I'm sure as a company or managers you have every excuse in the book why you have 181 Yelp reviews and a 2.5 star rating, however, you are what your customers say you are. You officially suck.

TMJJzt8cbkVTRkJyRRFvqg.text: I used to love Cadillac Ranch and often go before the I go to Cinemark. It's usually perfect because their happy hour is from 5-7 and we usually got to the 7:00 or 7:30 movie. Happy hour used to encompass $5 martinis, but now they are $6 which isn't a a big deal but I was very annoyed with the dynamics of the bar. My friend and I ordered cocktails because the happy hour menu said, "$2 off all cocktails." We selected our drinks from the portion of the menu titled "cocktails." After our second round, she informed us that cocktails were consider drinks such as a rum and Coke, vodka cranberry, etc. I politely told her that we ordered from the cocktail menu and her reply was, "Well, it's not my rules." In addition, the bartenders did not communicate well. One bartender would take our order and then another one would come over and ask if we wanted to order. It was very disorganized. They had live music while we were there... at 5:30. It was SO LOUD I couldn't even hear my friend who was sitting right next to me. The only good thing I have to say is that the pepperoni sausage flatbread was pretty good! Other than that, the unprofessionalism really turned me away.

p1RZd6QYI2RN2QplpLpBSg.text: By far one of my favorites in the area! They even have some Pittsburgh specific items that you can't get anywhere else, like the pierogi flat bread! Yum! Also, I have been here for my birthday with a large group (8 people) and the wait staff and bartenders were very friendly and helpful! All around great place.

mIDiQ6RfmKsWsK7RS27aNA.text: From out of town and travel for work. Hostess wasn't the brightest bulb, but my server was great. Asked to sit outside at the bar was seated at a table outside, but after traveling all day wasn't in the mood to ask to move.  Ordered the asian salad and it was pretty good. Not great, but good. I did like the the outside atmosphere.  I would come back again to sit outside and try another dish. Happy hour is probably a good time too.

nlixUfDeJjLVxR8no_Pjkw.text: This was easily the top five happy hours I've been to this year. Not only were we seated right away on a busy Friday afternoon, but our servers were quick with drinks and the food came out fast and hot. With more than a dozen items to choose from on the happy hour menu, we easily found something that we both would enjoy and at a great price. Get the chicken quesadilla, it's only 5 bucks and is sure to make your tummy and wallet smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken quesadilla
Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buff chick dip
Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $3-$4-$5 Happy Hour Menu

aOzbFMMma8fE1pKXYWRqaA.text: Drink and app were good, but the entree was a disaster. Sirloin was a bit dry, even though it was covered in sauce and butter. The sides were the worst. The potatoes definitely tasted like they were instant and the green beans were unseasoned and tasted like they were boiled? We don't plan on returning.

K6E8GbRL5PRu7QBk-6AOoQ.text: Today I went shopping at  Settlers  Ridge  All was good I  decided to stop over at  Cadillac Ranch for a cocktail after shopping.  I went to the 1st bar just inside of the door I stood there 4 25 mins I timed it on my cell B4 someone came over to asked if I would care 4a drink. This is not the first time this has happen to me at this same establishment. 4 bartenders walked in front of me, looked at me  But did not ask if I care 4 a drink or anything.   I literally looked into the eyes of one bar bartender and she finally came over and asked me what would I like after 30 minutes this is Poor customer service.

Fz3MRdVQ2eMB8o36CIL51g.text: Get a new chef!   The lobster bisque was aggressively salty and had some strange artificial aftertaste. Not good at all. The shrimp tacos were pathetic. One shrimp per taco does not a taco make.   Our server was fantastic and honest but the food is reprehensible. I wouldn't give it to a rat.

XuhlA1wzq0ge8L1ImoChDg.text: Just stood and waited 15 min to be seated, but no one was at the front to even greet us. Bartender saw us standing and didn't even acknowledge us. Was really excited to eat here for the first time, disappointed we didn't get to.

I0PcCNBLWSWCc8RxqAh6_Q.text: Traveling through Pittsburgh and found this gem!   Don't let the star ratings scare you away because the food was really good and the service was awesome as well. No plans to return to Pittsburgh but if we ever do, we'll definitely come back for dinner and drinks.

XIykFYAotLhGf19WtKEzbg.text: This place had the best happy hour specials!  I tried the Bay Seasoning dry rub wings and I still crave them to this day.  They had the best taste and dipped in that sauce it was amazing.  My co-workers tried just about everything on the happy hour menu and I tasted a little bit of it all.  Nothing wasn't great.    It was very loud in there, but I can see why with the specials they have.  A very large drink selection with cocktails and beers.  Nice place to go after work and hear some live music.

2_A7ifrHr_yMxXyMnPl8hw.text: I remember when Cadillac Ranch first opened many years ago .. it was the place to be for happy hour!  My visit for the first time in many months was a bit surprising. It was a Friday night - 9 PM and many empty bar stools.    It definitely has changed since the last time I visited. The service was good because it wasn't too crowded and the noise level was down a bit so it was ideal if you were trying to talk to someone... noise level down.     After only 1 drink-- me and my friend decided to go somewhere else.   The atmosphere just wasn't cutting it for the good mood I was in... it was bit somber.   I had to give at least three stars in this review because I have had many good visits in the past.. from happy hour gatherings, blind dates, and work function dinners.  I  just think maybe there's too much competition out at the point now.

PRmkEmYX2M__-8VGty8wWw.text: Good outside seating and very slow and less attentive service. They didn't ask for water refill and when we asked, it took them more than 10 minutes to bring us water. Secondly, we asked for a box to take the left over food which they never brought.   Food is also disappointing. We ordered margherita pizza, spinach artichoke dip and potato chips. The pizza is very bland and unappealing. It had absolutely no flavor. However, I managed to eat 3 slices since  I was very hungry. Even after requesting them to add less toppings to the chips, they loaded our chips with toppings. So, that was a miss too. My friend liked the spinach and artichoke dip, but she never got a box to take the leftover.   Overall, very disappointing experience. I don't think I will go back again.

0v4bsWFwhdZY6xxWyIeDPA.text: This restaurant has sadly gone off the rails.  After driving an hour and a half in anticipation of one of my favorite meals, disappointment was all I got.  My once fresh greens salad was nothing but bagged lettuce.  The 21 oz.. rib eye came out medium rare instead of medium well.  My side dishes got cold while I waited on it to be redone.  Zach the manager on duty insisted nothing had ever been changed.  When I said it would be hard to return in the future, I was dismissed with "well if there is anything I can do while you are still here let me know". Well I am letting EVERYONE know, do not spend these prices for the present quality provided. After persuasion from our server, the bill was comped for this visit.  I raised the rating from 2 to 3 stars due to this.

zZEvtBsrUILt0o3N7_47ew.text: Ran out of sirloin. Overcooked the NY strip. The burger had enough grease to lube my car. Served me wrong beer. TERRIBLE FOOD.

9rQ5ev5Cl9WetoQliXdYvg.text: So, it's a Saturday night and I'm in town for business. I went and saw a movie at the Cinemark right by the Cadillac Ranch. By the time I got out, it was 10:50pm and there wasn't much else open and around, so I took a chance. I was by myself by the way. Anyway, the hostess didn't seem like she wanted to seat me, because she kept pushing for me to go to the bar. Finally I got a table and Alexis came and took my order and waited on me. She was awesome. Definitely felt a little out of place, as there was lots of drinking and dancing going on, but I was hungry. Alexis really took care of me. Her only "slip up" of the night was after she brought my credit card receipt back she said, "Have a good night...okay?" (tilt of the head). Ouch! I'm out of town and I was hungry and it was late. I ordered the Basalmic Chicken. It was actually pretty dang good. Three chicken breasts, mashed potatoes and green beans. It was really loud in here, but that's to be expected on a Saturday night. I believe there was a girl celebrating her birthday and bunch of employees from Victoria's Secret there.

SrI_HbgCP6I9448peOc-0g.text: Great Meatloaf and the Fish & Chips with homemade Chips also really good. Pricing is not bad either.

_pC5IVf164BPzP9SUKtgyA.text: Recently got a virus from a sick employee along with 15+ other people according to the Health Department. Please do not eat here at least until the investigation is over and they are cleaned. I have never been so sick in my life!!!!!

j7IPAr9QWuw9YS5GN2vnKw.text: I was there on a Sunday afternoon . We sat at the bar had drinks and appetizers . The place is very dark but I guess that's good if you want to watch sports on their many televisions . The service was poor . The place was not crowded at all but the bartender either didn't notice us when we sat down or ignored on purpose . After sitting for 5 minutes , I got up walked around to the other side of the bar and asked for some service and menus . The bartender handed us menus wihout saying too much of anything . The speciality drink menu is limited and I felt pricey . I had a pizza at the bar and that was good . All and all not a bad place and with a friendlier staff this place could be fun for happy hours and later on a Friday or Saturday night . They do have a mechanical bull to ride but we were told that it only operates after 10 pm on wednesday to Saturday nights ???  Why so limited hours for something that would be fun anytime , I don't know .

egB6yFip46izBjS1u2nOsQ.text: My husband and I stopped by Cadillac Ranch today as we have drove by it a couple times and wanted to try it. Despite the horrible reviews I've read online, we wanted to give it a try ourselves. The hostess was very friendly and immediately took us to our table. It took almost 15 minutes for a server to come to our table. There was a group of 4 that sat down at the table beside ours and was immediately greeted by a server. When we were finally greeted by a very friendly young lady the rest of our visit went very well. We order the Margarita Flatbread pizza and it was DELICIOUS!! We then ordered our entrees. They came out rather quickly and we were pleased. The prices are a bit high to eat there on a regular basis but we felt the prices were pretty on with the portion sizes. Overall experience was nice.  There are dozens of restaurants in the area to choose from. For the prices, service needs to get better to attract customers. I truly believe that the "recession" is not hurting restaurants...it's the employees and managers hurting the restaurants. This place has the foundation to be great..unfortunately I feel it's ok..but definitely not great.

NPwhuKQhbrDPaSTGi5BQLg.text: Stopped in before a movie to get their dinner and a movie deal.   The place always has a pretty solid menu. I ordered the grilled bbq chicken on a pretzel bun.  It was all good.  Hubby had a buffalo grilled chicken sandwich with the optional wheat bun for a $1 additional. Not really sure why they feel the need to charge an extra dollar for wheat....  Service was fast and and not unfriendly. Although not especially friendly.   A little disappointed we couldn't sit outside since it was such a nice night. But they do allow smoking out there so it was probably a better choice to be inside.   Oh, and if you're expecting a bull ride as still advertised on their website...you'll be disappointed as they removed it years ago. Should update their website.

UKgCOVG5oDkwKtiBX9M_fg.text: I went here again because it's a nice restaurant with outdoor seating.   I ordered their specials of guacamole dip and chips and this Hawaiian chicken sandwich thing with pineapple salsa on it............ didn't like it  My service was good and the venue is a nice place but the food here is hit or really a big miss. My food was terrible. The guacamole was bland and my Hawaiian chicken thing sandwich was a cheap, flavorless dry tasting piece of cardboard that I had to force down.  They really need to spend time getting the food to taste good here for such a nice venue.

PL5U5W18DFB_HenFiBMG_Q.text: We arrived at 415 on a Friday as a party of 6 (4 adults and 2 children).  After we were seated our waitress took our drink orders and took 15 minutes to return with them and to take our order.  We never had silverware and had to ask for that.  It took 40 minutes after she took our order for us to get our food.  We never got refills of our drinks.  The food was decent but not worth the price.  The service was some of the worst that I've had in a long time.  I would hate to see how bad the service is when the place is actually busy.  The atmosphere is pretty cool and there are nice outdoor sitting areas.  This may be a better place to just come for a drink instead of to sit down with a family to eat.

ar1av-i5jnEaxwoGbDOjjQ.text: I am currently at the bar trying to pay for the drinks I ordered 20 minutes ago. There are 2 bartenders here. One has ignored multiple customers, and she waited on others when my ordered wasn't completed. I had to chase down the other bartender to get my last drink that the first bartender forgot.   This post took about 10 minutes. Still haven't paid. Also, the bar is empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar area

KyUNlLtZ6dKNtsbcg6jZog.text: Cadillac Ranch is a convenient stop for a drink or bite for those going around Settler's Ridge. It's pretty large and has a lot of seating so it's usually pretty quick to get seated. They have a good selection of beers and drinks and their food is pretty standard. We've gone for boneless wings the last few visits. The first time, the wings were ready quickly and tasty! The last few times though, there was quite a long wait and the wings seemed to be mostly breading and very little meat. May just be hit or miss depending on the day.   Nonetheless, it's a solid place to stop for a beer or break!

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

zNKZH662tBQcEMeKIgw9tQ.text: I came here Sunday night for a pick up order. I had ordered the ahi tuna appetizer, green beans, and sweet potato fries.   The tuna and green beans were great, but the fries were soggy, and the dipping sauce provided was gross.   The customer service was lacking, as I had to ask the bartender upon entering to get my food as the host was not present.   As the service and food was subpar, so is my rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside view

CekzFRtNR5qBa1NPraaBTw.text: I went here on a Monday night around 9:45 pm, unfortunately the kitchen was closed so I didn't get to try any of their food, but maybe next time.  Since the bar was open we did sit down to talk and have a few drinks, we talked with the bartender for awhile.  It was nice atmosphere not that many people there on a Monday night.  They keep the bar really clean and offer a complete menu of drinks and drinks are very good.  The first drink I tried was the black cherry margarita which I didn't take a picture of, but it was sweet and tarty with a kick and it was good.  Pictures below is something I asked the bartender to be creative and make whatever she wants, but sticking with tequila which is what I was already drinking and is in the picture I took.  I think this was a tequila sunrise.  I can't wait to come back and try the food I can always smell the good aroma from the parking lot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

1QmoimmMtAnwgN6iCu1mGg.text: My husband and I were going to the movies and with his foot in a cast boot our lunch options were limited. It has been years since I've been to this place and has it ever changed. Gone is the mechanical bull ride. Another type of game off in the corner has taken its place. Even the rest rooms have changed-the stalls are painted black along with black toilets.  The place was fairly empty and we pretty much had the whole place to ourselves. They do offer one perk-If you are going to the movies that day or have seen a movie and have the stub then they will give you one entree at half price as long as you purchase one at regular price. Fortunately I had our tickets on my phone so she accepted that as our coupon.  My husband had a barbecue chicken tossed salad. I went with the French onion burger. Instead of paying the up charge for sweet potato fries I asked substitute broccoli for the regular fries. I ordered medium well but I guess I should have had it well done because I'm no fan of seeing "pink" in the middle. The burger was okay-nothing to write home about. They do give you a good size of broccoli which was filling.  Seemed like it took a long time to get our drinks replenished but the waitress finally did. Place is a bit pricey for the food but the coupon helped soften the blow. Made for an easy walk to the theater so my husband could rest his foot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Barbecue chicken salad
Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French dip burger

LVMdE3EEDfGLJf4AmnK58g.text: Nice place to stop for a beer. Food, not so good. Service was weak. Between 3 bartenders they could not figure out if I had a tab. Friends had cocktails that were extremely weak, like maybe missing the alcohol.

9wDX8lPkuZCbUR_isJfPxQ.text: Sat at the patio bar & Rachel was our bartender who made our experience so worthwhile. She was so kind & attentive had great recommendations and can make some BOMMMMB lemon drops. 10/10 will be back to see her again!

7OMp-KzOwdBO03yQ8zw0FA.text: Had a nice dinner with my best friend here this past Friday evening. We made reservations at 730 for the outside patio and were seated promptly. We both ordered the sirloin steak and added a side salad. The salad took a bit of time to come but they refunded us for them, we didnt even ask! Our waitress checked on us often and the little acoustic band they had outside was enjoyable! Our meals were very good as well as the cocktails we had!

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sirloin Steak with mashed potatoes and green beans.

Mk60QJqwOhNTADfoVnHVIw.text: Very tasty food. Excellent service. The cowboy ribeye was a delicious cut of meat and cooked to perfect. The chicken was also cooked perfectly and the sauce over it was very good. I would recommend this place. Large TVs and would be awesome to watch football here. However, the WiFi service was not great. See the pics to make your mouth water!
