SqIso5sICuSa-rYbA37eVQ.text: Bartender did a great job . Food was pretty good . Prices ok . Nice crowd . Nice location

BFWIeY32XxGzaq1pUkzU9g.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! The atmosphere, the service, the music videos, the food, and the happy hour! What's more to love. I will always love Cadi before or after a movie or after work with the colleagues. Cadillac Ranch forever!!!!!!!!

Knw_JXNDQAp0KxWnZQSsfQ.text: I visited Cadillac Ranch in mid-December with a friend for dinner.  It was on a Monday night and was far from busy.  I've visited the restaurant before ordering the meatloaf and two different steaks.  I ordered the BBQ pork chops off of the seasonal menu.  Portions were gigantic.  Cooked to perfection.  It came with mashed potatoes and succotash.  My friend ordered a steak and was quite happy with his meal as well.  My only gripe was the drink prices.  6.50 for a mixed drink with well vodka seems excessive.  My friend inquired about if the wine was dry and the waitress had absolutely no idea.  It's a shame there are no happy hour specials or I would return more often.

tuRDji-vTPYSAlwZjYqZJg.text: I've visited Cadillac Ranch on many occasions so I figure it's time I officially give them a review. While I haven't been here many times for a sit down dinner I have been here many times for happy hour. With the Cinemark right next door it's a great place to meet up for drinks/appetizers before a show. Especially on a Tuesday for discount movie day!  The few times I actually sat down for a meal I was impressed with the food. I typically always go with a salad and I've always liked them. They also have a lot of really good drinks on their menu. Their mojito's are amazing! My only complaint is that their drink prices are fairly expensive. Because they are so expensive I typically never order them. I stick to basic drinks during happy hour to avoid paying those prices.  Last but not least, I want to hit on their awesome happy hour. Besides Mad Mex I would say this is definitely my favorite happy hour spot in Robinson. They have a happy hour food menu which includes different items for $3, $4, and $5. Some of the items include chicken quesadilla, boneless wing, chili nachos, fries, soft pretzels, tacos, flatbreads, etc. Over the years I have tried a lot of them and I have to say the only one so far that I haven't liked is the chicken quesadilla's. My go to is always the nachos and I'm actually very picky about my nachos. So trust me they are good.   If you haven't tried Cadillac Ranch for happy hour or dinner yet I highly recommend it! They also do live music in the summer outside which is really nice and I think they even have a special on entrees if you stop in after a movie with your ticket stub.

VmTzCWRD0xjHx_6yuVBYuQ.text: I've been to Cadillac ranch about 4 times. Service is absolutely terrible & the bar drinks are even worse the only reason I've gone back is because of their food and their location. 2 out of 10- wish i could give them more but after 4 visits with the same issues i just can't

qQeB5_6vVc6SlbXruiCgIA.text: Nice little spot combining a "pub" feel with theme specific nights (trivia, kids eat free, etc.) and appeal of some good American grill food. Friendly bar staff as well. Pretzel sticks and dips are good as well as the Black and Bleu burger and sweet potato fries.

bRXP6K50p2ABYhEvugvldQ.text: My good friend and I went for happy hour. It was from 5-7pm and we sat at the bar.  The drink specials are pretty good. I think it was a dollar off drafts.  They have a good menu for happy hour. They have food for 3-8 bucks I believe. I had the pizza and it was delicious! It was a decent portion as well.   He had a good time and the bar wasn't crowded. I would suggest happy hour. The seating is pretty good with a nice patio.  I will definitely go back here for happy hour.

YuVa52bWtNGLanwgOBPruQ.text: Group of 6 ordered drinks & waters, waited 20 minutes (and asked 2 different servers) for waters. Ordered 2 appetizers, the spinach and artichoke dip and loaded fries. Never received silverware, extra plates, or napkins. Chips that came with artichoke dip came as about 10 individual chips and ONE giant chip. Loaded fries were obviously waiting so long to come out that the cheese was no longer hot and fell off all of the fries. So I enjoyed plain fries and sour cream. Waiter was no where to be found majority of meal. Would not return, would not recommend, especially as my FIRST time trying this establishment.

NFhZaT2OxsCm5Qz3QT7y7Q.text: Went for happy hour and ended up staying for dinner.  Happy hour drinks were good and well priced.  Food was blah.  Had a flat bread pizza which was the best thing that was ordered by the group.  Real thin crust and crisp.  My fiance had a burger which he ordered medium but came out over cooked and dry.  Fries were blah.  Nothing special about his place.

rTZC0MO5w-yBb8S-fFEmOA.text: The atmosphere was great, the food was also great. The service was not so good. Pricey, but that's ok. Just thought the service could have been better, they weren't very busy and almost had to beg to be waited on. I'll give it one more try though.

PRXWluEapwzBWAhOTxNQMQ.text: A group of 4 of us ladies visited here on Saturday, July 3 at 7PM.  I ordered the steak salad for $13.95 (pretty pricey) and asked for the steak medium.  The steak came way overcooked, the edges were black and the meat was hard.  Upon returning the steak I received a new one which was still well done and not medium the way I ordered.  BTW the steak comes sliced on the plate so the cooks and the waitress should have easily seen how well done it was.    If that was our only issue I would probably be okay but there is more.    The service was terrible!  Our server was "Nikki J."  She ignored us throughout our entire meal.  I needed more dressing for my salad but she was no where to be found.  My friend had some that she shared with me.  When the waitress finally returned after our meals were complete she asked if we wanted any dessert.  We ordered more cocktails and my friend ordered a coffee.  When she brought our drinks she also brought our checks.  Did we ask for our checks???  No.  Did we look like we were even close to being done??  No.  The coffee was terrible, old and cold.  Did the waitress ever come back and check on us or notice that the coffee was not touched?? No.  Remember she had already brought us our checks.  After at least a half hour we paid our bills.  Did the waitress ask us if we needed anything else?  No.  We would have ordered more drinks.  My one friend had to ask for a refill of her iced tea.  She brought us our receipts to sign and after about another half hour she returned and asked if she could take our receipts.  It was clear that she getting ready to go home.  We weren't!!!  Still no one asked if we needed anything.  Shortly thereafter we saw our waitress leave.  Three of us still stayed until after 1AM.  Still sitting at the same table.  Still with no one waiting on us.  At one point we went up to the bar to order more drinks and then returned to the table.  There were other waitresses around waiting on other tables but not ours.  After our waitress left we were discussing how we should speak to a manager.  Do you think we ever saw one?  No.  We were there from 7PM until after 1AM and we had a total of 3 drinks, one of which we had to go up to the bar and get ourselves.  And these were $6.54 martinis!!  You think someone would have wanted to wait on us??

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pittburgh Steak Salad

LY9SUrCinWZ81wj8dPBtLg.text: Went there for my son's birthday. We were pretty excited, heard the food was good and could not wait to eat. The website says their happy hour is thought the restaurant. When we got sat the server said we could only get happy hour in the bar and there were no seats available in there. The food was awful. He got a full rack of ribs and said Applebees ribs are better! That's crazy since there ribs are microwaved. He had wings as an appetizer and couldn't even eat them they were that bad. I had the salmon with green beans and mashed potatoes it was ok, nothing to rave about. None the less we paid over 100.00 for bad food, bad service. I'll never go back.

J_SDgvnfpE0r-dJuoCBQJA.text: I was extremely disappointed with this place.. We had a large party for my birthday (15 people) last night and after we got to our table INside I had reserved a week before requesting outdoor seating weather permitting (it was beautiful out) one of the 2 servers we had said to us "are you done moving seats yet?" In a snotty tone which was her attitude the whole time... Then we got or drinks and ordered our food... Everyone got their food except me (I ordered fish and chips) and the other server apologized saying there was a mix up, it would be out in 2 minutes. That would have been fine except that i t didn't come out 2 mins later it came out an HOUR AND 13 MINS later.... The manager comped my meal but didn't bother to apologize to me... The servers brought out shots for everyone and didn't say it was from them so everyone at my table was asking each other who ordered them, it was very confusing.... And my fish was not good it was pretty much all batter w a hint of fish inside.... I was thoroughly upset that my birthday dinner was a huge let down w the awful service and not so great meal... Others at my table got the fish tacos and they were good.. But that is the only positive thing I can say unfortunately

HwUMvkMLXmwJH_WRRmkspA.text: Not terrible but not memorable either.  Pulled pork sandwich was better than expected but once again not memorable.  Place seemed very large which did not create the best ambiance in my opinion

CgxCDbYcunzFBqyGFySumg.text: The only reason I would possibly visit this place again is for the mechanical bull and drinks.  Other than that, the service was a-ight.  The male bartender paid not mind to the thirsty customers at the bar as he schmoozed with his gal-friends as the female bartenders did all the work.  Who's managing this place?  Drinks were good - but who messes up mixed drinks and beer.    Dessert for cherry cobbler (with not so much cobbler and nothing but pie filling) gets a thumbs down.    Bull riding - We arrived some time after 7pm and asked the gab-alot-boy bartender about the bull ride.  He stated it would happen at 9pm.  After 9pm gab-alot it still gabbing...then we find out from him the mechanical bull is down.  Now, that's bull!  Like I said, I will come back for possibly drinks and the bull ride, but other than that this is a forgettable place where I would rather not spend a dime.

6KWDMj4pnYiWgAda3PG-Yw.text: Went to dinner. Nothing special. Got a burger. Pretty bland. Service was friendly. Sister had a beer and said was skunky.

SxnB8HlmAL6It5BrEaKOQw.text: Quite possibly the grossest bathrooms I have ever seen. I've been to truck stops that were cleaner. Sign on door says bathrooms checked and signed by employees every 15 minutes. And the chart was empty.

flMknBlvpA0twDp3WVqG2w.text: A fun place to get a drink and some good food. Try out the mini-fish tacos here amf enjoy the patio for some live music.

niJL-fRuAxPf2xCVXqx75A.text: Staff is always friendly and the bartenders are charismatic! I go at least once a week now to the happy hour! Great drink and food specials from 5-7! If you're going for dinner it can get pricey for basic dishes.

W9BWrg_IX7euPVa6bI79sg.text: Nice atmosphere, food is average. Nothing really stood out on the menu. We had a coupon so we decided to try it. I had the barbque chicken salad which was good and a came in a large portion. Would go back again for the atmosphere.

3mKZQYcDE4WGr5L5i1ZC5Q.text: Very disappointed.  The best part of our night was that we were seated promptly. Things went down from there. The wait staff was inattentive and very slow. We ordered a margarita flat bread pizza and wings to start. The best part of the pizza was the crust, as expected it was crispy. But the pizza had no taste to it at all, very bland. The wings came out cold, and were below average in quality. Our entrees were not any better. My wife ordered the fish and chips. The fries were okay, the fish was greasy and overcooked. While this is better than being undercooked, it tasted like it was fried in 2 week old oil that has not been filtered or cleaned. VERY GREASY, VERY GROSS!!! I ordered the Pittsburgh Steak Salad, and was unimpressed. The steak was undercooked for how I ordered it, and very bland. They used steak fries that were in a greasy cheesy pile on one side of the plate. I would have preferred to have the fries my wife was served with her fish and chips on my salad.  Overall, 1 star is too good. This was our first and only visit. I found it too dark, with bad club music. With a name like Cadillac Ranch, and an advertisement for a mechanical bull, I expected more of a country music atmosphere. Prices were slightly more expensive than they should of been for the amount of food served, and way too expensive for the quality of food.

TDQX50cEV11HX2mIBFqveg.text: There's a lot of haters here.  I actually enjoy the Cadillac Ranch.  No, I don't go here for the line dancing or bull riding.  Sure it has a country theme, but you know what?  It also has a great bar and LOTS 'o TVs to watch the game of your choice.  We went here to watch the BCS championship this week and had a great time.  The food was decent only (-1 star).  They were very busy and the service was great!

feGTe1QibH548eT5vvH6yQ.text: The food and service are bad. Just bad. We were with a group of 7 and the server was rude from the time we sat down. The food was very pricey and soooo less than average. It was edible, but pretty bad. The atmosphere is cool though, that's why it got 2 stars. If you can find some good drink specials it would be a cool place to have happy hour, (assuming the bartender provides better service than the waiters), just don't think about eating anything. For 2 beers, an appetizer portion of cheeseburger sliders with COLD soggy tasteless fries, and a pulled pork sandwich with the same fries it ran us about $40.00 plus tip.   They clearly spent all their money on the atmosphere and next to nothing on food and staff training. Wouldn't go back.

AGlhwhRTI1w_TVSV4ZJ6Ng.text: Food selection was OK. The atomosphere and decor is really cool and different. Not much on the menu for healthy eaters. It is more of a steak and potatoes (American) kind of place. I went there because it was one of only 2 places to eat in settler's ridge using the Entertainment book.

YTaiTtwFedo_yXZxw26s3Q.text: Went there after a movie. Don't go if you want a quiet drink. The live music was so loud it was unbearable. Didn't stay five minutes. Will maybe go back if they turn the amplifiers down a bit.

-rM-ouXAd5pawSq2kSgGbA.text: Went here for dinner with some friends. I would totally recommend getting the wings in BBQ sauce. They were delicious! We then shared the pierogie pizza, mushroom pizza, and spinach dip. Definitely enough food for 3. The pizza's are a pretty good size. The spinach dip looked different but didn't taste bad.

PfcXW3ErLph3AJ1a82awKw.text: Recently went to the ranch. Not a fan. Over an hour wait. Food was average which we had to wait for. Confusing place as to what exactly it's supposed to be is it a sports bar? Is it a country bar? Is it a rock and roll type place? All in all not a great place

P3f7ezWEdCqcdbh-Vrb2Mg.text: good bar scene and has bands. food is okay.

4P6l9k430bYxoA8x3af1iw.text: I should have listened to the other reviewers. The food was not very good for the price. I have had better food at McDonald's. Music too loud, service was less than desirable, and food was gross.

NIAb1bE467bS6golhkdn7w.text: Everyone who has tried the pork chops, keeps coming back for them. They are amazing! The atmosphere is also great.

KXBAHLY9Q2Zp8HZZZv_Lgw.text: Typical 'burbs establishment and honestly it works in this setting.  Ya it's like a teenage kid in terms of having an identity crisis - cowboy-ish with a middle-class casual restaurant feel (think Applebee's, Fridays, Max & Erma's), a bit sports bar-ish with their tvs on the walls and then let's throw in a club in to this mix and there you have Cadillac Ranch.    I can't comment to the food as I've never ordered anything off the menu except for drinks.  Drinks were decent and service was ok.  If there were several other options in the area to go out to then I'd likely bypass CR but there's not, so this will have to do when you're out and about in this plaza area.

y60LJQ_A7o_J-p6Pq0QQhQ.text: The beer is good thats about it ! Cant find a waitress for your life ! Food well needs some help !

-T-qPBvnLvN4ys39XM05-Q.text: I've been here several times before.  Tonight I went and took a seat at the bar.  I got my drink relatively quickly (slow by my standards).  I was not asked if I wanted a menu   It was dinner time.   I waited mores than 20 minutes  another gentleman sat down next to me. He had been waiting 10 Minutes and was not even acknowledged.   Please note there were 4 bartenders and the place was not busy.    I finally waved The  bartender down.  The gentleman sitting next to me and I adVised her that we had been waiting an unnecessarily long time. She took our order with almost no apology for the service.    after completing my meal she Asked if I wanted another drink to which I replied not yet.  Within minutes she asked of I wanted to cash out to which I replied not yet.  A few minute later she came back she came back and asked again. At this point i said sure She brought me the bill And I inquired why she was in a hurry to have me leave.  Basically I guess I wasn't ordering drinks fast enough for her.  The gentleman sitting next to me stated that he had never seen this ever happen.   To make matters worse, if they could be, I spoke to the manager on the way out. He was almost dismissive of my complaint.  I wasn't looking for any compensation just acknowledgement.

415dma-PGWMGIeyhEY3THQ.text: Had a great time with some co-workers at Cadillac ranch. Sampled the happy hour menu liberally and couldn't find anything bad. It was a bit difficult to find seating the later it got, but the service was always quick despite the crowd.   It looked like they have pong nights, trivia and live bands. Can't say I caught the schedule, but all in all seemed to be a fun place to unwind.

7V8dBq3IySehxcERKnkN_w.text: I'll give it 2 stars for the drinks at the bar and patio. My husband and I ate here once for dinner and it was ok.  Nothing special.  What happened afterward was the bad part. I am usually the one with the stomach problems, but after our dinner at Cadillac Ranch my husband was up all night with issues. The "issues" were so bad that he required a trip to the ER the next day for fluids. We have never gone back for food. I have heard many stories of other people getting sick after eating here.    Be warned.

vZa037ExMyf8_PPWO5Mvjg.text: Nothing special just a typical chain place with ok food.  A few of us stopped here before heading to movie. Menu has a variety of food to choice from and drinks are good. Server was nice and responsive.

VivJju4iJ1fzbG4JbaQcJg.text: If you like salad at all you HAVE to try the two apples spinach salad with steak. OMG. So. Good. It would almost be worth the drive back from KY just to have it again...the nachos are delicious too!

ui4j_9WywM_dhakmGl-aXw.text: Very disappointing. Overpriced for what they serve. The turkey dinner was pressed turkey breast. The stuffing was soggy. My husband couldn't even finish cause it was so bad. I had the fish tacos which were good, but they must have used gold fish on each taco. Skimpy for the price of the meal. The worst part was I finished my drink almost completely before I realized my glass was filthy dirty! Ugh.  Last time I'm going here. Proceed with caution

lAquv2lRRqBuCoMnoaPUnw.text: If you are coming just for the drinks then this is a great place...but the food is equivelent to an average meal at TGIF or Applebees.   Again ..the bar staff is always great...but the food/wait staff aren't too good. Last visit our food was brought out by back of the house staff, waitress saw they came so never came until we were done, i ate my entire meal without a drink and our fries were cold/hard, probably cooked 2 or 3 times.   Go to their bar, I'd avoid dinner

Yd5QPEaIPaawTGGgTh9UFg.text: If you want an adventure for dinner this is your place. We called to ask if they take reservations, we were told no. When we arrived we found that they do take reservations.. We arrived at 6:10pm and were seated a 7:35pm. Seated only to notice many open tables. Our food arrived at 8:45pm..  You would think after 2 1/2 hours the food would be good. It sucked.. The pulled pork was cold but the BBQ sauce was microwave hot.. We all ordered sweet potato fries and were treated to sweet potato tater tots, they suck too..The experience lasted 3 hours and 15 minutes, it will be our last.. L

-fE9izjF-2ZrV19WkFoTRA.text: DO NOT GO.   poor service.  ordered our meals and it took 70 minutes to arrive.   Found out that our 'server' did not put the order in for 30 minutes and made excuse that it was busy.   It was moderately crowded--sat right down and there were empty tables.  Food was good.  Service was lousy.  Sticky floors, not clean.

QhYqfo9St6qaz4-1pUIn-w.text: Yuck!  This is what happens when you have to choose between a trip to Target in the burbs and a good restaurant in the city.  The good restaurant lost out for tonight.    I got the A-1 mushroom burger.  My first mistake.  After having the great burgh burger tour of 2011 in process, this burger didn't stand a chance!  It was....bleck!  The A-1 sauce was just dripping in mass amounts off the burger.  I love me some sauce, but this was obviously to overcompensate for the lack of taste in the patty.  The meat was just blah.  It was the strangest thing!  It looked like meat and felt like meat, but there was absolutely no taste!  And to top off the icky burger was the limp fries.  NO ONE wants a limp fry...am I right ladies (and men of course!)?    My hubs got the ribs and I quote him...."they were less than ok."  That pretty much sums up the whole place.  Less than ok and not even worth the one star.  Boo!

28IDRBFrhlBqYnNeCpw4hw.text: Nothing ever goes wrong when I come here. I come here about 2 or 3 times a year. The ribeye is fantastic and so are the appitizers. I've never had an issue with the service either.

I7BTqXHvEAz3KDL0LX7FpA.text: This place does not disappoint, despite the  constant craze of high volume customer flow. They seem to care about each and every customer and their food.  I cannot express enough, how impressed I am with their food, the quality and presentation. Some of my favorites: candied pork chops, no bull burger, black and blue salmon salad and their flat bread variations.   Also, props to the bartenders who actually care about how much you've had to drink. The willingness to call a cab, offer food or anything else that displays concern was highly impressive.   Another incident that deserves praise, was when I ordered the salmon salad as take out. When I arrived to pick it up, the hostesses assured me that it was being prepped and should be out soon. I proceeded to pay for it in advance and waited in the lobby/receiving area. I observed the hostesses as they alternately checked on my order. They were extremely polite and apologetic for the long wait. After 20 minutes one of them came up to me and truthfully shared that the cooks had just started cooking the salmon. She seemed scared, but kept her professional composure. I finally decided to let her know, that it was ok and that I was in no rush. I also shared that I'd rather have the cooks take the time to prep the food correctly, instead of "half ass-ing" it.   After a total of an hour wait, I received my to-go salad with a receipt that stated that the food was on the house. What a wonderful and unexpected surprise! Most restaurants still try to get your money in this situation.  Bravo to Cadillac ranch and on the superior training of their staff.  Thank you for showing you care!

x_llNIPutV-perBz27xw5w.text: If you like grease then you will love this restaurant.  Cadillac Ranch is your typical yeee-haw, ride 'em cowboy, all-american bar and grill with oversized portions of mediocre food drenched in grease, smothered in cheese and sprinkled with a heaping mess of empty calories. It. Is. Disgusting. My skin is crawling just thinking about it. Please do America a favor and refrain from giving this place any more money than it already has. Please. For your children's sake.

nvnCpLEsby4Z6PttkkYc4g.text: The food here is really good....  HOWEVER, it does not overcome the fact that the service is awful!!!  When I say awful, it is hands down the WORST service that I have ever received in any service industry establishment.  I travel all over the US for months at a time and this is the slowest and poorest service I have ever received! And to top it off the bartender who my wife and I once did receive decent service from, I tipped him $50 and the next time we came In, he was too busy flirting with a girl that was sitting at the bar and asked a server to come wait on us instead.  It's a shame that with such great food, that it takes hours to get your food and it takes hours to get a drink because the bartender Is too busy fitting with the women at the bar!  Hopefully the cooks leave and start a new restaurant and leave all the servers and bartenders behind.

fqBVHDA3xDGzlukLSMBM-A.text: I ate here this past Friday with a dining companion.  Cadillac Ranch was extremely crowded upon arriving and we were told that there would be a 45 minute wait.  During the wait we got to check out he decor of the restaurant which was nice with lots of music and Western apparel visible.  Our wait did only last as long as we were told but it was very frustrating as there were many open tables that were not being sat.  We watched one table sit for 20 minutes between being cleaned and having people put in it.  The table that we were eventually put in sat for at least 10 minutes before we were seated.  It's not like there were spreading out the tables for the servers either as our server was triple-sat in a 5 minute window.  For me this was very perplexing as the bars were beyond packed and the wait list was not too long.  For dinner I ended up ordering the Ranch Mac' N Cheese while my dining companion had the pork chops.  Our dinner was served quickly and my Mac' N Cheese came out piping hot.  It's flavor was great and it was something that I thoroughly enjoyed eating.  My dining companion also enjoyed her pork chops.  The bottom line for me is that I will head back to the Cadillac Rance again but not on a weekend night.  Their food was great and although they quoted the right amount of time to be seated, it was very frustrating to see the many empty tables sitting for a long time before the hostess would seat people.

Gpa3unh51gVSgWQlzdKnXw.text: First time here. Loud!  Food just ok and that includes their specialties. Service just ok but mainly because our poor waitress was all over the restaurant. Her station was everywhere!  Could not give good service if she tried. Dirty plates left on table the whole meal. It would take a lot to get me back here.

pv_d-r-QC2GJpLBSXVgxSA.text: Everything about this place screams mediocrity.  The biggest knock, is that it is a bit overpriced. The biggest upside, is that the staff is always friendly. If you come here, prepare yourself for a typical Chain experience.

159TJt0bBYNxKON6esXcyg.text: Went here on for a late night quick bite a couple times in the past year and we always ordered the fish and shrimp tacos. The tortillas can be a little bit dry but other than that it's so good. The shrimp and fish are always perfectly cooked and not dry. Our waitresses and the bartenders are also very nice as well. The price is a little bit high for the quality of the food but other than that we'll definitely return sometimes for some quick-fix tacos craving!

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp/fish tacos my favvvvvv

jdu31nNUVIjKjThtbpB0wg.text: I am so glad I didn't listen to some people who posted bad reviews. Last night I visited CR and loved it. We sat outside in the courtyard area on a beautiful Saturday night. We both had the filet and it was great. The service was also pretty timely.  If I had to complain about anything, it would be the garlic sauce on the filet. It was just a little much and my steak was cooked medium instead of rare. On most steaks medium would be a problem, but with the tenderness of the filet, it was nothing at all. Great place! I'll be back!

LUH4arLfwK7UiEd01612NA.text: Hit or Miss. Onion rings were fantastic but were placed on a bed off old and cold onion straws. Chili was not even lukewarm when brought out. Most of the food was tasty.  2 apple spinach salad was drenched in salad dressing.  Waitress did not ask us how our food was.  We received some sort of bar tax and our drinks were sweet tea and cherry coke. They could turn this place around easily with some changes to become 4 star.

kuIhvUjr5XsViMCEWYGVAg.text: Cadillac Ranch is a typical American food chain on par with Chili's and Applebee's. Nothing exceptional, but the food meets a quality standard and has nice variety. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here, nor would I avoid it if I needed a timely meal on my way to the airport.

Mdx-66Cw-jCuPohjNE5JJQ.text: Stopped in for an early dinner with my girlfriend after shopping in Pittsburgh. Atmosphere was nice. Anywhere you sat, you were able to catch the game on one of the many TVs. We had the chili nachos for an app(which I highly recommend). The only reason I am leaving 4 stars is because the two of us had burgers cooked medium. Her's was an actual medium and mine was well done. Other than that everything was great. I would return a second time if I were in the area.

1HGNg-wSH3zm2koG6ORzCg.text: Very mediocre and extremely rude service! Waitress only came over to our table to take our orders, and once after that to refill our drinks and to check how our entrees were. When we ordered drinks prior to the meal, my friend who is 21 ordered a beer while I ordered a water since I'm under 21, when we did this she rudely informed us that she couldn't serve him alcohol because I was under 21 and she said it was "dram shop" law. She stated that we needed to google the law, which we did and it stated that bars are not allowed to serve alcohol to customers who appear intoxicated. When she brought us the check right after the meal she did not even thank us. I also heard other tables surrounding us complaining about how rude she was.   As for the food, it was decent and large portions but still not worth it for the price. Ambience was nice as we sat out on the patio, but still don't think I'll go back!

967NYj7PTPFNhpzisUxAbQ.text: Although the Cadillac Ranch is a visually attractive venue, its food is disappointingly bad. When one looks at the photos of its food offerings, it is easy to be impressed. But the food delivered to one's table is something  else again.   I recently ordered one of their featured items-- a large bowl of chili. The bowl was  huge. However, there was very little chili and what there was war burnt and tasteless. They gave me a lot of colored tortilla chips, which I found totally unappetizing. Considering how the beans were  falling apart, I suspect that the chili was days old and simply reheated too many times. It wasn't nearly as good as the chili at Wendy's.   It's a sad day when a joint that pretends to be upscale can't match the food of a fast food restaurant.   On another occasion, I ordered a burger with fries--common enough fare. The burger was dry and tasteless and the fries were cold. Once again, it didn't equal the burgers turned out by a fast food restaurant. You would do a lot better with a Five Guys burger.  To sum it up, I consider the place to be a  pretentious dump.

L0PGum15k2lePWbkgqjM8g.text: Very typical chain-like restaurant food, it's not my style at all, but everything was okay.  I had the Steak Salad, and my friend had the Flatbread.  The service was excellent, our waitress was very helpful and charming, and the food arrived quickly.  Not a big wine selection, as you might expect, but some okay wines all the same.  This place will do in a pinch.

VBdpdGQXsjRB4rDgSEypUg.text: This is the third time we have been here the past year.  The chicken diablo and ribs are always good.  The hostess told us we would have to wait for the outside covered seating.  When we informed her there was an open table she smiled, thanked us and told us she would have a busboy clean it off right away.  Our adorable waitress, Mallory had the chef come out to discuss gluten free options with one member of our party.  This 20 something young man was very attentive and not inconvenienced in the least.  The nachos turned out to be a great option.  My chicken option was tasty.  I am not sure where the negative reviews have come from.  We have had three good experiences.

QlYtzHayRJ4vlb2gZbnYgQ.text: I went there before Valentines Day with my daughter and it was lovely. The decoration was nice and he staff were friendly. The food delicious and looks good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cadillac Ranch - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

2EtQXv1MpfeLtEZ1lPjQQQ.text: We decided to eat an early dinner at The Cadillac Ranch on a Saturday. Our raised booth allowed us to see across the dinning area and bar which are nicely decorated. However, the divider was dusty and a dip tin was left from whomever previously been sitting there. And I was not happy about hearing the entire conversation of our neighbors despite my efforts to focus. The architect/designer probably should consider adding taller dividers.   Our server was capable.. Not particularly friendly but we had no True issues.  As for the food, I ordered a side salad which was large. While nothing special, it was good. Unfortunately, the tomatoes were off tasting and I had to eat around them. For an entre I ordered the meatloaf. If not for the thin barbacue sauce, the meat would have been flavorless. Meanwhile, the broccoli was cooked well (no one likes rubbery veggies) and the whipped mashed potatoes were delicious but could have been warmer.   We would probably try other places before returning, but I would not say no to giving them and another dish a second chance.

8TWhWlbr6sgYpHXFn5U2Vg.text: I must say some of the less than four stars puzzle me.  My first experience of the New York steak is very good.  The pita with taco fixing was very good too.  Cooked medium meant medium.  Good value price wise and parking was ample.  The atmosphere was bustling and noisy which is good for an informal restaurant.

LScxR1ZByTBbO_w_ARs7ug.text: I've gone to Cadillac Ranch for different occasions, from personal to business meetings.   Overall, the environment and vibe is nice for any occasion. The space itself is decorated nicely, giving you the option to watch a variety of TVs or chat with whomever you're with. The food is average, my favorite being the alarm burger and tortilla soup. The outside patio looks like a great place to eat and I hope to eat there when I return

MxYtPSsxxdSbN6s1ocyI8Q.text: By far one of the best steaks I've ever had, cooked to perfection. The chefs sure know what they're doing. And the butter that comes on top is the things dreams are made of! I've been to this location numerous times and I have never had a bad experience. The staff and managers are so accommodating and truly care about your experience. Highly recommend Cadillac Ranch! Can't say enough amazing things about this place! Definitely will be back!

KdVgnqR-uHbniDF8aSDpnw.text: Never go here again.  Out of the item I ordered. Substituted without asking!  Would not have discounted my meal or told me of yhe substitution unless I asked.

Wxth3qGIYhN0boTbyUa0bQ.text: I haven't been here for years but I have a group that we meet once a month for a happy hour and then head over to the cinema for a movie around 7pm.  I didn't make a reservation because the last time we met there it wasn't crowded, maybe because the kitchen caught on fire and they couldn't do anything but serve drinks so we drank.  So needless to say it was crowded but the hostesses at the door were very friendly so we all gathered around the seats available and ordered the happy hour specials.  I didn't expect much since they were so reasonable.  Wrong!  Everyone raved on what they ordered, the pulled pork sliders excellent, a couple of us ordered those, Ben ordered the fish tacos, he couldn't rave enough about them! did he share NO! So the next time I will have to try them. The truffle infused French fries very good, not greasy, glad that I got to try them, some ordered some other things on the menu and all were happy with their food they couldn't say enough about what they had... again do you think they offered to share? Not!  Our server was stressed but it was very busy and she was doing a good job  So if you decide to go .. have an open mind, a forgiving heart if everything isn't just your way.. the food was good and I am looking to go back and try other things.  Stella

t6-1kcqop-4rtjOsp6WXew.text: Surprised to see so many children sitting at the bar at least no one was smoking at the same time

Wt6Jse-vekv9rn1QBCMEeg.text: Went after work, around 6PM on a Wednesday night.  It was busy, but there was no wait for a table.    Seems like a good spot to go after work for a few drinks and simple meal.  They had a live band which was pretty good.  Service was quick, our waiter stopped by frequently.  I ordered the spicy shrimp tacos.  Very good, though kind of a small portion.  As a table, we shared an order of Cadillac Ranch Chips (I think it's what they are called), which were VERY good.    When I'm staying in the city, there are plenty of great spots within walking distance.  But if you are staying outside of the city, this is one of the better places I've found.  Will likely go back again.

HKYD01Ck3T_rAz9D9M_p1Q.text: I met some folks there for a happy hour.    My reviews are usually more expansive but it was just hard to get a drink there at the bar.    I don't think I will be back.   This location had a bigger crowd then the one I have visited in Cincinnait.  Service - pretty bad (bartenders) - we had to flag her down several times to get a drink.  Cost - not bad  Food - We just had driniks - but looking at the food reviews - I am glad I did not.   I will just pick it up at the awesome Giant Eagle Market District they have ;-)  I would not waste my time with this place unless you needt the location (note there is Sone Peppers right around the corner / never been but will try)
